Comment: Perhaps nozar is a dedicated e4 player. I shouldn't be too concerned either way.
I've cut my teeth defending through the Sicilian. A powerful counter which may be unwieldy at times. Nevertheless, I think it is appropriate here. This should be a treat for both of us.
Well at least he's not a Grand Prix Attack player.
Nc6 instead of d6 because I mean business today.

Why not be bold? It's just a blitz.

White has joined the dance.
Bxf6?! Once again nozar allows me to damage his pawn structure. I wonder if he understands the implications of doing so?
Bxf6?! Once again nozar allows me to damage his pawn structure. I wonder if he understands the implications of doing so?
I guess opening files on the Queenside meant that much to him. Not a bad position because I cannot immediately coordinate a Kingside response. I will need to turn his doubled pawns into a liability.

I'm pretty much running on autopilot here.

I still have not worked out the kinks of this "plan." Somehow, I am going to isolate files a,b & c from the rest of the game and then force a pawn through. I'm thinking geometrically in hemispheres (for want of a better word) rather than moves at this point. My biggest risk is that the whole game crumbles and I suffer a back-rank mate but I suspect I'm safe here.
